clues.text: In "Twelve Angry Men", the men make up this group
Tracie Bennett was spot on as this legendary performer in "End of the Rainbow", set towards the end of her life
Bradley Cooper used no makeup or prosthetics in the role of John Merrick in a Broadway revival of this play
This Wendy Wasserstein play focuses on 3 Jewish siblings: Sara, Gorgeous & Pfeni
The musical "Hello, Dolly!" was based on this 1954 Thornton Wilder play that also featured Dolly Levi
In this Disney film, Scuttle the seagull shows off his knowledge of human things to Ariel, telling her a fork is a "dinglehopper"
Seagulls eat a lot of Paul Rudd's flying transports in this 2018 comic book sequel
In "The Shallows", Blake Lively names her seagull companion this, a pun on a ponytailed action star
Annette Bening & Saoirse Ronan starred in "The Seagull", a 2018 adaptation of this Russian's play
A lone seagull draws first blood on this actress in Hitchcock's "The Birds"
To suddenly swerve in a different direction
Mentions of these gentle people in the Bible are found in Psalm 22 & in Matthew 5
Vladimir Putin enjoys a cocktail made with horseradish & this veggie beloved in Russia
Synonyms for this verb include consider & judge
Delicate & intricate patterns of thin gold or silver wire used as decoration
The Straits of Florida connect this body of water to the Atlantic Ocean
This river flows into Lake Constance, which borders Switzerland, Germany & Austria
The Cayman Islands are in this sea
Named for an Englishman, it connects the Atlantic & the Pacific between Cape Horn & the South Shetland Islands
In French it's known as Le Golfe de Gascogne
You can get custom designer fangs of this classic lit character for $19.99 at Party City, just like the author intended
The body of this crawler is composed of around 15 to 180 segments, each with a pair of legs, the first pair modified into poison fangs
A type of this snake is rightly called spitting--its fangs are shaped to send poison flying
This fanged monster whose name is Spanish for "goat-sucker" was first "sighted" in 1995 (though after a scary movie)
The protruding fangs of this mortal Gorgon known for her stone-cold gaze weren't even the most terrifying thing about her
"Any old music will do" for Tina Turner in her hit song about a "Private" one of these
To be this title person you've got to "know when to walk away & know when to run"
In song, a desperate Warren Zevon requested these professionals along with "guns & money"
Bob Marley sang about the "Buffalo" this to "win the war for America"
"Dear sir or madam will you read my book? It took me years to write, will you take a look?" goes this Beatles tune
This astronaut left the Earth for good in 2012 in a hospital at 3000 Mack Road, Fairfield, Ohio
Thousands flocked to 9 12th Avenue, Houghton, Johannesburg after he passed away there in 2013
She made her exit in 1962 after an overdose of sleeping pills at 12305 Fifth Helena Drive, in the Brentwood area of Los Angeles
He expired in 1827 in Vienna at Schwarzpanier Strasse 15 during thunder like that in his 6th symphony
She breathed her last in 1901 at a Osborne House on the Isle of Wight,  surrounded by many children & grandchildren

rounds.comments: (Alex: "Go" will be the second syllable in the correct word in each response.)

clues.text: Any self-centered person who probably thinks this clue is about them
The musical stylings of Orpheus helped this crew escape the Sirens' song
Botticelli painted a trying time for Jesus in his work titled this "in the Garden"
The spire on the top of one of these Japanese temples is called a sorin
Excessive nationalism can also be called this other type of "-ism"
During an 1858 brawl on the House floor, one representative accidentally grabbed this off the head of another, revealing him to be bald
"Elbowgate" rocked Ottawa after this PM bumped a rival MP in the chest before a 2016 House of Commons vote
In Arkansas in 1837, one representative fatally stabbed another with this weapon named for a man killed the year before
In 1972 an Ulster MP slapped Britain's home secretary who told parliament that "Bloody" this day was self-defense by British troops
After John McLaurin & Benjamin Tillman traded punches on the Senate floor in 1902, the Senate voted 54-12 to give both this rebuke
Lucious Lyon on "Empire" was partly based on this rapper--should we infer that Cookie is Beyoncé
Washington, D.C. fixer Judy Smith inspired Olivia Pope on this drama
The name of Idris Elba's character on this HBO show comes from Baltimore criminals Bernard "Stringer" Reed & Roland Bell
Preet Bharara was reportedly an inspiration for Paul Giamatti's character on this Showtime drama set in the financial world
Women's wrestling director Matt Cimber is an inspiration for Marc Maron's character on this show set in the 1980s

Absorbed into the blood slower than nitrogen, this lightest inert gas is mixed with oxygen for deep-sea divers
This inhaled anesthetic gas with a 5-letter name was first used for surgery in 1842
Trademarked in 1930, it's the name for gases used as refrigerants thanks to their low boiling points
Trapped in pockets underground where plant decomposition has occurred, natural gas is primarily this gas
Harriet Brooks is sometimes credited with discovering this 5-letter element, a gas emanating from thorium

rounds.text: Based on a French novel by Henri Murger, its title refers to the carefree life artists lead
